message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

This paper deals with language identification, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a new feature extraction method using hashing, which falls under the category of machine learning (ML). Hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also uses Support Vector Machines (SVMs) for classification, which is a popular ML algorithm used in information retrieval (IR) tasks. Therefore, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper uses image-based features for language identification, which is a common approach in computer vision (CV). Hence, cs.CV (Computer Vision) is also a possible sub-category.
